introduction: In this video, the speaker discusses how to increase your chances of getting an internship at IBM Quantum or any other quantum computing company. The focus is on the getting to the interview stage of the application process, as this is where applicants have the best chance of success. The speaker highlights three specific applications: hardware internships, software internships, and research internships. To make your application stand out, it's essential to be specific about your qualifications and interests, focusing on the aspects that align with the job requirements.

sections.title: Section 1: Understanding IBM Quantum Internships
content: IBM Quantum hosts over a hundred interns every summer, offering three specific applications: hardware, software, and research.
Applicants need to apply to a specific category, and their application and resume are put into a pool for hiring managers to select them.
The specific job requirements and projects vary for each category, so it's crucial to research and understand the expectations before applying.
The speaker encourages applicants to choose one or two specific aspects that align with their interests and qualifications.

sections.title: Section 2: Tips for Applying to IBM Quantum Internships
content: To increase your chances of getting an interview, focus on being specific about your qualifications and interests.
Choose one or two aspects that align with your interests and qualifications and put them at the top of your application or CV.
Research the specific job requirements and projects for each category to ensure your application is tailored to the position.
The speaker emphasizes the importance of understanding the expectations and requirements for each category.

sections.title: Section 3: Hardware Internships
content: Hardware interns at IBM Quantum need specific experience in areas like EM-RF and microwave, along with basic or even quantum mechanics experience.
Hands-on experience with connectors, power, and mechanical design is also desirable.
Software development skills for automation purposes are also necessary.
The speaker highlights the importance of understanding the specific requirements for hardware internships.

sections.title: Section 4: Software Internships
content: Software interns at IBM Quantum can work on the front-end or back-end part of development.
Specific languages like C++, Rust, PiTorch, SQL, Pandas, and Kiske are in demand.
Candidates should demonstrate clean code principles and work collaboratively in a team environment.
The speaker emphasizes the importance of understanding the specific requirements for software internships.

sections.title: Section 5: Research Internships
content: Research internships at IBM Quantum focus on specific areas of quantum computing research.
Candidates should have a strong background in quantum mechanics, physics, or related fields.
Experience with programming languages like Python, C++, or Rust is also necessary.
The speaker highlights the importance of understanding the specific requirements for research internships.
